     304             : 
     305             : /* Forward declarations */
     306             : /*! \page Def_syntaxlang Asterisk Language Syntaxes supported
     307             :     \note Not really language codes.
     308             :         For these language codes, Asterisk will change the syntax when
     309             :         saying numbers (and in some cases dates and voicemail messages
     310             :         as well)
     311             :       \arg \b da    - Danish
     312             :       \arg \b de    - German
     313             :       \arg \b en    - English (US)
     314             :       \arg \b en_GB - English (British)
     315             :       \arg \b es    - Spanish, Mexican
     316             :       \arg \b fr    - French
     317             :       \arg \b he    - Hebrew
     318             :       \arg \b is    - Icelandic
     319             :       \arg \b it    - Italian
     320             :       \arg \b nl    - Dutch
     321             :       \arg \b no    - Norwegian
     322             :       \arg \b pl    - Polish
     323             :       \arg \b pt    - Portuguese
     324             :       \arg \b pt_BR - Portuguese (Brazil)
     325             :       \arg \b se    - Swedish
     326             :       \arg \b zh    - Taiwanese / Chinese
     327             :       \arg \b ru    - Russian
     328             :       \arg \b ka    - Georgian
     329             :       \arg \b hu    - Hungarian
     330             : 
     331             :  \par Gender:
     332             :  For Some languages the numbers differ for gender and plural.
     333             :  \arg Use the option argument 'f' for female, 'm' for male and 'n' for neuter in languages like Portuguese, French, Spanish and German.
     334             :  \arg use the option argument 'c' is for commune and 'n' for neuter gender in nordic languages like Danish, Swedish and Norwegian.
     335             :  use the option argument 'p' for plural enumerations like in German
     336             : 
     337             :  Date/Time functions currently have less languages supported than saynumber().
     338             : 
     339             :  \todo Note that in future, we need to move to a model where we can differentiate further - e.g. between en_US & en_UK
     340             : 
     341             :  See contrib/i18n.testsuite.conf for some examples of the different syntaxes
     342             : 
     343             :  \par Portuguese
     344             :  Portuguese sound files needed for Time/Date functions:
     345             :  pt-ah
     346             :  pt-ao
     347             :  pt-de
     348             :  pt-e
     349             :  pt-ora
     350             :  pt-meianoite
     351             :  pt-meiodia
     352             :  pt-sss
     353             : 
     354             :  \par Spanish
     355             :  Spanish sound files needed for Time/Date functions:
     356             :  es-de
     357             :  es-el
     358             : 
     359             :  \par Italian
     360             :  Italian sound files needed for Time/Date functions:
     361             :  ore-una
     362             :  ore-mezzanotte
     363             : 
     364             : */
     365             :

     627           0 : static int exp10_int(int power)
     628             : {

     634             : 
     635             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_cs: Czech syntax
     636             :  *
     637             :  * files needed:
     638             :  * - 1m,2m - gender male
     639             :  * - 1w,2w - gender female
     640             :  * - 3,4,...,20
     641             :  * - 30,40,...,90
     642             :  *
     643             :  * - hundereds - 100 - sto, 200 - 2ste, 300,400 3,4sta, 500,600,...,900 5,6,...9set
     644             :  *
     645             :  * for each number 10^(3n + 3) exist 3 files represented as:
     646             :  *              1 tousand = jeden tisic = 1_E3
     647             :  *              2,3,4 tousands = dva,tri,ctyri tisice = 2-3_E3
     648             :  *              5,6,... tousands = pet,sest,... tisic = 5_E3
     649             :  *
     650             :  *              million = _E6
     651             :  *              miliard = _E9
     652             :  *              etc...
     653             :  *
     654             :  * tousand, milion are  gender male, so 1 and 2 is 1m 2m
     655             :  * miliard is gender female, so 1 and 2 is 1w 2w
     656             :  */
     657           0 : static int ast_say_number_full_cs(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, const char *options, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)
     658             : {
     659           0 :         int res = 0;
     660           0 :         int playh = 0;
     661           0 :         char fn[256] = "";
     662             : 
     663           0 :         int hundered = 0;
     664           0 :         int left = 0;
     665           0 :         int length = 0;
     666             : 
     667             :         /* options - w = woman, m = man, n = neutral. Defaultl is woman */
     668           0 :         if (!options)
     669           0 :                 options = "w";
     670             : 
     671           0 :         if (!num)
     672           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     673             : 
     674           0 :         while (!res && (num || playh)) {
     675           0 :                 if (num < 0) {
     676           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn));
     677           0 :                         if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
     678           0 :                                 num = -num;
     679             :                         } else {
     680           0 :                                 num = 0;
     681             :                         }
     682           0 :                 } else if (num < 3 ) {
     683           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d%c", num, options[0]);
     684           0 :                         playh = 0;
     685           0 :                         num = 0;
     686           0 :                 } else if (num < 20) {
     687           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
     688           0 :                         playh = 0;
     689           0 :                         num = 0;
     690           0 :                 } else if (num < 100) {
     691           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num /10) * 10);
     692           0 :                         num %= 10;
     693           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000) {
     694           0 :                         hundered = num / 100;
     695           0 :                         if ( hundered == 1 ) {
     696           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1sto", sizeof(fn));
     697           0 :                         } else if ( hundered == 2 ) {
     698           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/2ste", sizeof(fn));
     699             :                         } else {
     700           0 :                                 res = ast_say_number_full_cs(chan, hundered, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     701           0 :                                 if (res)
     702           0 :                                         return res;
     703           0 :                                 if (hundered == 3 || hundered == 4) {
     704           0 :                                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/sta", sizeof(fn));
     705           0 :                                 } else if ( hundered > 4 ) {
     706           0 :                                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/set", sizeof(fn));
     707             :                                 }
     708             :                         }
     709           0 :                         num -= (hundered * 100);
     710             :                 } else { /* num > 1000 */
     711           0 :                         length = (int)log10(num)+1;
     712           0 :                         while ( (length % 3 ) != 1 ) {
     713           0 :                                 length--;
     714             :                         }
     715           0 :                         left = num / (exp10_int(length-1));
     716           0 :                         if ( left == 2 ) {
     717           0 :                                 switch (length-1) {
     718           0 :                                         case 9: options = "w";  /* 1,000,000,000 gender female */
     719           0 :                                                 break;
     720           0 :                                         default : options = "m"; /* others are male */
     721             :                                 }
     722           0 :                         }
     723           0 :                         if ( left > 1 )      { /* we don't say "one thousand" but only thousand */
     724           0 :                                 res = ast_say_number_full_cs(chan, left, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     725           0 :                                 if (res)
     726           0 :                                         return res;
     727             :                         }
     728           0 :                         if ( left >= 5 ) { /* >= 5 have the same declesion */
     729           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/5_E%d", length - 1);
     730           0 :                         } else if ( left >= 2 && left <= 4 ) {
     731           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/2-4_E%d", length - 1);
     732             :                         } else { /* left == 1 */
     733           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/1_E%d", length - 1);
     734             :                         }
     735           0 :                         num -= left * (exp10_int(length-1));
     736             :                 }
     737           0 :                 if (!res) {
     738           0 :                         if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
     739           0 :                                 if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1)) {
     740           0 :                                         res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     741             :                                 } else {
     742           0 :                                         res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
     743             :                                 }
     744             :                         }
     745           0 :                         ast_stopstream(chan);
     746             :                 }
     747             :         }
     748           0 :         return res;
     749             : }
     750             : 
     751             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_da: Danish syntax
     752             :  New files:
     753             :  - In addition to English, the following sounds are required: "1N", "millions", "and" and "1-and" through "9-and"
     754             :  */
     755           0 : static int ast_say_number_full_da(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, const char *options, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)
     756             : {
     757           0 :         int res = 0;
     758           0 :         int playh = 0;
     759           0 :         int playa = 0;
     760           0 :         int cn = 1;             /* +1 = commune; -1 = neuter */
     761           0 :         char fn[256] = "";
     762           0 :         if (!num)
     763           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     764             : 
     765           0 :         if (options && !strncasecmp(options, "n", 1)) cn = -1;
     766             : 
     767           0 :         while (!res && (num || playh || playa )) {
     768             :                 /* The grammar for Danish numbers is the same as for English except
     769             :                 * for the following:
     770             :                 * - 1 exists in both commune ("en", file "1N") and neuter ("et", file "1")
     771             :                 * - numbers 20 through 99 are said in reverse order, i.e. 21 is
     772             :                 *   "one-and twenty" and 68 is "eight-and sixty".
     773             :                 * - "million" is different in singular and plural form
     774             :                 * - numbers > 1000 with zero as the third digit from last have an
     775             :                 *   "and" before the last two digits, i.e. 2034 is "two thousand and
     776             :                 *   four-and thirty" and 1000012 is "one million and twelve".
     777             :                 */
     778           0 :                 if (num < 0) {
     779           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn));
     780           0 :                         if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
     781           0 :                                 num = -num;
     782             :                         } else {
     783           0 :                                 num = 0;
     784             :                         }
     785           0 :                 } else if (playh) {
     786           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/hundred", sizeof(fn));
     787           0 :                         playh = 0;
     788           0 :                 } else if (playa) {
     789           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/and", sizeof(fn));
     790           0 :                         playa = 0;
     791           0 :                 } else if (num == 1 && cn == -1) {
     792           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1N", sizeof(fn));
     793           0 :                         num = 0;
     794           0 :                 } else if (num < 20) {
     795           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
     796           0 :                         num = 0;
     797           0 :                 } else if (num < 100) {
     798           0 :                         int ones = num % 10;
     799           0 :                         if (ones) {
     800           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d-and", ones);
     801           0 :                                 num -= ones;
     802             :                         } else {
     803           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
     804           0 :                                 num = 0;
     805             :                         }
     806             :                 } else {
     807           0 :                         if (num < 1000) {
     808           0 :                                 int hundreds = num / 100;
     809           0 :                                 if (hundreds == 1)
     810           0 :                                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1N", sizeof(fn));
     811             :                                 else
     812           0 :                                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num / 100));
     813             : 
     814           0 :                                 playh++;
     815           0 :                                 num -= 100 * hundreds;
     816           0 :                                 if (num)
     817           0 :                                         playa++;
     818             : 
     819             :                         } else {
     820           0 :                                 if (num < 1000000) {
     821           0 :                                         res = ast_say_number_full_da(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, "n", audiofd, ctrlfd);
     822           0 :                                         if (res)
     823           0 :                                                 return res;
     824           0 :                                         num = num % 1000;
     825           0 :                                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/thousand", sizeof(fn));
     826             :                                 } else {
     827           0 :                                         if (num < 1000000000) {
     828           0 :                                                 int millions = num / 1000000;
     829           0 :                                                 res = ast_say_number_full_da(chan, millions, ints, language, "c", audiofd, ctrlfd);
     830           0 :                                                 if (res)
     831           0 :                                                         return res;
     832           0 :                                                 if (millions == 1)
     833           0 :                                                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/million", sizeof(fn));
     834             :                                                 else
     835           0 :                                                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/millions", sizeof(fn));
     836           0 :                                                 num = num % 1000000;
     837             :                                         } else {
     838           0 :                                                 ast_debug(1, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
     839           0 :                                                 res = -1;
     840             :                                         }
     841             :                                 }
     842           0 :                                 if (num && num < 100)
     843           0 :                                         playa++;
     844             :                         }
     845             :                 }

     847           0 :                         if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {

     850             :                                 else

     853           0 :                         ast_stopstream(chan);
     854             :                 }

     858             : 
     859             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_de: German syntax
     860             : 
     861             :  New files:
     862             :  In addition to English, the following sounds are required:
     863             :  - "millions"
     864             :  - "1-and" through "9-and"
     865             :  - "1F" (eine)
     866             :  - "1N" (ein)
     867             :  - NB "1" is recorded as 'eins'
     868             :  */
     869           0 : static int ast_say_number_full_de(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, const char *options, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)
     870             : {
     871           0 :         int res = 0, t = 0;
     872           0 :         int mf = 1;                            /* +1 = male and neuter; -1 = female */
     873           0 :         char fn[256] = "";
     874           0 :         char fna[256] = "";
     875           0 :         if (!num)
     876           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     877             : 
     878           0 :         if (options && (!strncasecmp(options, "f", 1)))
     879           0 :                 mf = -1;
     880             : 
     881           0 :         while (!res && num) {
     882             :                 /* The grammar for German numbers is the same as for English except
     883             :                 * for the following:
     884             :                 * - numbers 20 through 99 are said in reverse order, i.e. 21 is
     885             :                 *   "one-and twenty" and 68 is "eight-and sixty".
     886             :                 * - "one" varies according to gender
     887             :                 * - 100 is 'hundert', however all other instances are 'ein hundert'
     888             :                 * - 1000 is 'tausend', however all other instances are 'ein tausend'
     889             :                 * - 1000000 is always 'eine million'
     890             :                 * - "million" is different in singular and plural form
     891             :                 * - 'and' should not go between a hundreds place value and any
     892             :                 *   tens/ones place values that follows it. i.e 136 is ein hundert
     893             :                 *   sechs und dreizig, not ein hundert und sechs und dreizig.
     894             :                 */
     895           0 :                 if (num < 0) {
     896           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn));
     897           0 :                         if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
     898           0 :                                 num = -num;
     899             :                         } else {
     900           0 :                                 num = 0;
     901             :                         }
     902           0 :                 } else if (num == 1 && mf == -1) {
     903           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dF", num);
     904           0 :                         num = 0;
     905           0 :                 } else if (num < 20) {
     906           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
     907           0 :                         num = 0;
     908           0 :                 } else if (num < 100) {
     909           0 :                         int ones = num % 10;
     910           0 :                         if (ones) {
     911           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d-and", ones);
     912           0 :                                 num -= ones;
     913             :                         } else {
     914           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
     915           0 :                                 num = 0;
     916             :                         }
     917           0 :                 } else if (num == 100 && t == 0) {
     918           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/hundred", sizeof(fn));
     919           0 :                         num = 0;
     920           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000) {
     921           0 :                         int hundreds = num / 100;
     922           0 :                         num = num % 100;
     923           0 :                         if (hundreds == 1) {
     924           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1N", sizeof(fn));
     925             :                         } else {
     926           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", hundreds);
     927             :                         }
     928           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fna, "digits/hundred", sizeof(fna));
     929           0 :                 } else if (num == 1000 && t == 0) {
     930           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/thousand", sizeof(fn));
     931           0 :                         num = 0;
     932           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000000) {
     933           0 :                         int thousands = num / 1000;
     934           0 :                         num = num % 1000;
     935           0 :                         t = 1;
     936           0 :                         if (thousands == 1) {
     937           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1N", sizeof(fn));
     938           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fna, "digits/thousand", sizeof(fna));
     939             :                         } else {
     940           0 :                                 res = ast_say_number_full_de(chan, thousands, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     941           0 :                                 if (res)
     942           0 :                                         return res;
     943           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/thousand", sizeof(fn));
     944             :                         }
     945           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000000000) {
     946           0 :                         int millions = num / 1000000;
     947           0 :                         num = num % 1000000;
     948           0 :                         t = 1;
     949           0 :                         if (millions == 1) {
     950           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1F", sizeof(fn));
     951           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fna, "digits/million", sizeof(fna));
     952             :                         } else {
     953           0 :                                 res = ast_say_number_full_de(chan, millions, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     954           0 :                                 if (res)
     955           0 :                                         return res;
     956           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/millions", sizeof(fn));
     957             :                         }
     958             :                 } else if (num <= INT_MAX) {
     959           0 :                         int billions = num / 1000000000;
     960           0 :                         num = num % 1000000000;
     961           0 :                         t = 1;
     962           0 :                         if (billions == 1) {
     963           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1F", sizeof(fn));
     964           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fna, "digits/milliard", sizeof(fna));
     965             :                         } else {
     966           0 :                                 res = ast_say_number_full_de(chan, billions, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     967           0 :                                 if (res) {
     968           0 :                                         return res;
     969             :                                 }
     970           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/milliards", sizeof(fn));
     971             :                         }
     972             :                 } else {
     973             :                         ast_debug(1, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
     974             :                         res = -1;
     975             :                 }
     976           0 :                 if (!res) {
     977           0 :                         if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
     978           0 :                                 if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
     979           0 :                                         res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     980             :                                 else
     981           0 :                                         res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
     982             :                         }
     983           0 :                         ast_stopstream(chan);
     984           0 :                         if (!res) {
     985           0 :                                 if (strlen(fna) != 0 && !ast_streamfile(chan, fna, language)) {
     986           0 :                                         if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))
     987           0 :                                                 res = ast_waitstream_full(chan, ints, audiofd, ctrlfd);
     988             :                                         else
     989           0 :                                                 res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);
     990             :                                 }
     991           0 :                                 ast_stopstream(chan);
     992           0 :                                 strcpy(fna, "");
     993             :                         }
     994             :                 }
     995             :         }
     996           0 :         return res;
     997             : }

    1075             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_es: Spanish syntax

    1085           0 :         int playa = 0;
    1086           0 :         int mf = 0;                            /* +1 = male; -1 = female */

    1088           0 :         if (!num)
    1089           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
    1090             : 
    1091           0 :         if (options) {
    1092           0 :                 if (!strncasecmp(options, "f", 1))
    1093           0 :                         mf = -1;
    1094           0 :                 else if (!strncasecmp(options, "m", 1))
    1095           0 :                         mf = 1;
    1096             :         }
    1097             : 
    1098           0 :         while (!res && num) {
    1099           0 :                 if (num < 0) {
    1100           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn));
    1101           0 :                         if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
    1102           0 :                                 num = -num;
    1103             :                         } else {
    1104           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1105             :                         }
    1106           0 :                 } else if (playa) {
    1107           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/and", sizeof(fn));
    1108           0 :                         playa = 0;
    1109           0 :                 } else if (num == 1) {
    1110           0 :                         if (mf < 0)
    1111           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dF", num);
    1112           0 :                         else if (mf > 0)
    1113           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%dM", num);
    1114             :                         else

    1130           0 :                         num -= 100;

    1182             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_fr: French syntax

    1274             : /* Hebrew syntax
    1275             :  * Check doc/lang/hebrew-digits.txt for information about the various
    1276             :  * recordings required to make this translation work properly */
    1277             : #define SAY_NUM_BUF_SIZE 256
    1278           0 : static int ast_say_number_full_he(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, const char *options, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)
    1279             : {
    1280           0 :         int res = 0;
    1281           0 :         int state = 0;                          /* no need to save anything */
    1282           0 :         int mf = -1;                            /* +1 = Masculin; -1 = Feminin */
    1283           0 :         int tmpnum = 0;
    1284             : 
    1285           0 :         char fn[SAY_NUM_BUF_SIZE] = "";

    1301             :                  * a second one requires repeating the loop just for the
    1302             :                  * second file. The variable 'state' remembers where we were.
    1303             :                  * state==0 is the normal mode and it means that we continue
    1304             :                  * to check if the number num has yet anything left.

    1306           0 :                 ast_verb(3, "ast_say_digits_full: num: %d, state=%d, options=\"%s\", mf=%d, tmpnum=%d\n", num, state, options, mf, tmpnum);

    1648             : 
    1649             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_it:  Italian */
    1650           0 : static int ast_say_number_full_it(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)
    1651             : {
    1652           0 :         int res = 0;
    1653           0 :         int playh = 0;
    1654           0 :         int tempnum = 0;
    1655           0 :         char fn[256] = "";
    1656             : 
    1657           0 :         if (!num)
    1658           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
    1659             : 
    1660             :                 /*
    1661             :                 Italian support
    1662             : 
    1663             :                 Like english, numbers up to 20 are a single 'word', and others
    1664             :                 compound, but with exceptions.
    1665             :                 For example 21 is not twenty-one, but there is a single word in 'it'.
    1666             :                 Idem for 28 (ie when a the 2nd part of a compund number
    1667             :                 starts with a vowel)
    1668             : 
    1669             :                 There are exceptions also for hundred, thousand and million.
    1670             :                 In english 100 = one hundred, 200 is two hundred.
    1671             :                 In italian 100 = cento , like to say hundred (without one),
    1672             :                 200 and more are like english.
    1673             : 
    1674             :                 Same applies for thousand:
    1675             :                 1000 is one thousand in en, 2000 is two thousand.
    1676             :                 In it we have 1000 = mille , 2000 = 2 mila
    1677             : 
    1678             :                 For million(s) we use the plural, if more than one
    1679             :                 Also, one million is abbreviated in it, like on-million,
    1680             :                 or 'un milione', not 'uno milione'.
    1681             :                 So the right file is provided.
    1682             :                 */
    1683             : 
    1684           0 :         while (!res && (num || playh)) {
    1685           0 :                         if (num < 0) {
    1686           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn));
    1687           0 :                                 if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
    1688           0 :                                         num = -num;
    1689             :                                 } else {
    1690           0 :                                         num = 0;
    1691             :                                 }
    1692           0 :                         } else if (playh) {
    1693           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/hundred", sizeof(fn));
    1694           0 :                                 playh = 0;
    1695           0 :                         } else if (num < 20) {
    1696           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1697           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1698           0 :                         } else if (num == 21) {
    1699           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1700           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1701           0 :                         } else if (num == 28) {
    1702           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1703           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1704           0 :                         } else if (num == 31) {
    1705           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1706           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1707           0 :                         } else if (num == 38) {
    1708           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1709           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1710           0 :                         } else if (num == 41) {
    1711           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1712           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1713           0 :                         } else if (num == 48) {
    1714           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1715           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1716           0 :                         } else if (num == 51) {

    1808           0 :         int playh = 0;
    1809           0 :         int units = 0;

    1893             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_no: Norwegian syntax
    1894             :  * New files:
    1895             :  * In addition to American English, the following sounds are required:  "and", "1N"
    1896             :  *
    1897             :  * The grammar for Norwegian numbers is the same as for English except
    1898             :  * for the following:
    1899             :  * - 1 exists in both commune ("en", file "1") and neuter ("ett", file "1N")
    1900             :  *   "and" before the last two digits, i.e. 2034 is "two thousand and
    1901             :  *   thirty-four" and 1000012 is "one million and twelve".
    1902             :  */
    1903           0 : static int ast_say_number_full_no(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, const char *options, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)
    1904             : {
    1905           0 :         int res = 0;
    1906           0 :         int playh = 0;
    1907           0 :         int playa = 0;
    1908           0 :         int cn = 1;             /* +1 = commune; -1 = neuter */
    1909           0 :         char fn[256] = "";
    1910             : 
    1911           0 :         if (!num)
    1912           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
    1913             : 
    1914           0 :         if (options && !strncasecmp(options, "n", 1)) cn = -1;
    1915             : 
    1916           0 :         while (!res && (num || playh || playa )) {
    1917           0 :                 if (num < 0) {
    1918           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn));
    1919           0 :                         if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
    1920           0 :                                 num = -num;
    1921             :                         } else {
    1922           0 :                                 num = 0;
    1923             :                         }
    1924           0 :                 } else if (playh) {
    1925           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/hundred", sizeof(fn));
    1926           0 :                         playh = 0;
    1927           0 :                 } else if (playa) {
    1928           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/and", sizeof(fn));
    1929           0 :                         playa = 0;
    1930           0 :                 } else if (num == 1 && cn == -1) {
    1931           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1N", sizeof(fn));
    1932           0 :                         num = 0;
    1933           0 :                 } else if (num < 20) {
    1934           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", num);
    1935           0 :                         num = 0;
    1936           0 :                 } else if (num < 100) {
    1937           0 :                         snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num /10) * 10);
    1938           0 :                         num %= 10;
    1939           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000) {
    1940           0 :                         int hundreds = num / 100;
    1941           0 :                         if (hundreds == 1)
    1942           0 :                                 ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/1N", sizeof(fn));
    1943             :                         else
    1944           0 :                                 snprintf(fn, sizeof(fn), "digits/%d", (num / 100));
    1945             : 
    1946           0 :                         playh++;
    1947           0 :                         num -= 100 * hundreds;
    1948           0 :                         if (num)
    1949           0 :                                 playa++;
    1950           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000000) {
    1951           0 :                         res = ast_say_number_full_no(chan, num / 1000, ints, language, "n", audiofd, ctrlfd);
    1952           0 :                         if (res)
    1953           0 :                                 return res;
    1954           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/thousand", sizeof(fn));
    1955           0 :                         num %= 1000;
    1956           0 :                         if (num && num < 100)
    1957           0 :                                 playa++;
    1958           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000000000) {
    1959           0 :                                 int millions = num / 1000000;
    1960           0 :                                 res = ast_say_number_full_no(chan, millions, ints, language, "c", audiofd, ctrlfd);
    1961           0 :                                 if (res)
    1962           0 :                                         return res;

    1966           0 :                                         playa++;
    1967             :                 } else {
    1968           0 :                                 ast_debug(1, "Number '%d' is too big for me\n", num);
    1969           0 :                                 res = -1;
    1970             :                 }
    1971             : 
    1972           0 :                 if (!res) {
    1973           0 :                         if (!ast_streamfile(chan, fn, language)) {
    1974           0 :                                 if ((audiofd > -1) && (ctrlfd > -1))

    2098             : /* ast_say_number_full_pl: Polish syntax
    2099             : 
    2100             : Sounds needed:
    2101             : 0               zero
    2102             : 1               jeden
    2103             : 10              dziesiec
    2104             : 100             sto
    2105             : 1000            tysiac
    2106             : 1000000         milion
    2107             : 1000000000      miliard
    2108             : 1000000000.2    miliardy
    2109             : 1000000000.5    miliardow
    2110             : 1000000.2       miliony
    2111             : 1000000.5       milionow
    2112             : 1000.2          tysiace
    2113             : 1000.5          tysiecy
    2114             : 100m            stu
    2115             : 10m             dziesieciu
    2116             : 11              jedenascie
    2117             : 11m             jedenastu
    2118             : 12              dwanascie
    2119             : 12m             dwunastu
    2120             : 13              trzynascie
    2121             : 13m             trzynastu
    2122             : 14              czternascie
    2123             : 14m             czternastu
    2124             : 15              pietnascie
    2125             : 15m             pietnastu
    2126             : 16              szesnascie
    2127             : 16m             szesnastu
    2128             : 17              siedemnascie
    2129             : 17m             siedemnastu
    2130             : 18              osiemnascie
    2131             : 18m             osiemnastu
    2132             : 19              dziewietnascie
    2133             : 19m             dziewietnastu
    2134             : 1z              jedna
    2135             : 2               dwa
    2136             : 20              dwadziescia
    2137             : 200             dwiescie
    2138             : 200m            dwustu
    2139             : 20m             dwudziestu
    2140             : 2-1m            dwaj
    2141             : 2-2m            dwoch
    2142             : 2z              dwie
    2143             : 3               trzy
    2144             : 30              trzydziesci
    2145             : 300             trzysta
    2146             : 300m            trzystu
    2147             : 30m             trzydziestu

    2149             : 3-2m            trzech

    2151             : 40              czterdziesci

    2153             : 400m            czterystu
    2154             : 40m             czterdziestu
    2155             : 4-1m            czterej
    2156             : 4-2m            czterech
    2157             : 5               piec
    2158             : 50              piecdziesiat

    2182             : 90              dziewiecdziesiat

    2586           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);

    2637             : /*! \brief  determine last digits for thousands/millions (ru) */
    2638           0 : static int get_lastdigits_ru(int num) {
    2639           0 :         if (num < 20) {
    2640           0 :                 return num;
    2641           0 :         } else if (num < 100) {
    2642           0 :                 return get_lastdigits_ru(num % 10);
    2643           0 :         } else if (num < 1000) {
    2644           0 :                 return get_lastdigits_ru(num % 100);
    2645             :         }
    2646           0 :         return 0;       /* number too big */
    2647             : }
    2648             : 
    2649             : 
    2650             : /*! \brief  ast_say_number_full_ru: Russian syntax
    2651             : 
    2652             :  additional files:
    2653             :         n00.gsm                 (one hundred, two hundred, ...)
    2654             :         thousand.gsm
    2655             :         million.gsm
    2656             :         thousands-i.gsm         (tisyachi)
    2657             :         million-a.gsm           (milliona)
    2658             :         thousands.gsm
    2659             :         millions.gsm
    2660             :         1f.gsm                  (odna)
    2661             :         2f.gsm                  (dve)
    2662             : 
    2663             :         where 'n' from 1 to 9
    2664             : */
    2665           0 : static int ast_say_number_full_ru(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, const char *options, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)

    2667           0 :         int res = 0;
    2668           0 :         int lastdigits = 0;
    2669           0 :         char fn[256] = "";

    2671           0 :                 return ast_say_digits_full(chan, 0, ints, language, audiofd, ctrlfd);
    2672             :

    2674           0 :                 if (num < 0) {
    2675           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn));
    2676           0 :                         if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
    2677           0 :                                 num = -num;
    2678             :                         } else {
    2679           0 :                                 num = 0;
    2680             :                         }

    2686             :                         }

    2691           0 :                 } else if (num < 1000){

    2908             : /*! \brief  ast_say_enumeration_full: call language-specific functions

    2910          14 : static int say_enumeration_full(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, const char *options, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)

    2912          14 :         if (!strncasecmp(language, "en", 2)) {        /* English syntax */

    2917           0 :            return ast_say_enumeration_full_de(chan, num, ints, language, options, audiofd, ctrlfd);

    2924             :         }
    2925             :

    2930             : /*! \brief  ast_say_enumeration_full_en: English syntax

    2932          14 : static int ast_say_enumeration_full_en(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char *ints, const char *language, int audiofd, int ctrlfd)

    2935          14 :         char fn[256] = "";
    2936             :

    2938          15 :                 if (num < 0) {
    2939           0 :                         ast_copy_string(fn, "digits/minus", sizeof(fn)); /* kind of senseless for enumerations, but our best effort for error checking */

    2941           0 :                                 num = -num;
    2942             :                         } else {
    2943           0 :                                 num = 0;
    2944             :                         }

    2949           1 :                         int tens = num / 10;

    3473           0 :                 gender = "N";
    3474             :         } else {
    3475           0 :                 gender = "";

    4294          12 :                                                 res = ast_say_date_with_format_en(chan, t, ints, lang, "BdY", tzone);
    4295             :                                         }
    4296             :                                 }
    4297          12 :                                 break;
    4298           0 :                         case 'R':

    4300           0 :                                 break;

    4302             :                                 /* Seconds */
    4303           0 :                                 if (tm.tm_sec == 0) {
    4304           0 :                                         snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);

    4308           0 :                                         if (!res) {
    4309           0 :                                                 snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_sec);
    4310           0 :                                                 res = wait_file(chan, ints, nextmsg, lang);

    4313           0 :                                         res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_sec, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);
    4314             :                                 }
    4315           0 :                                 break;

    5126             : /*! \brief ast_say_date_with_format_he Say formatted date in Hebrew
    5127             :  *
    5128             :  * \ref ast_say_date_with_format_en for the details of the options
    5129             :  *
    5130             :  * Changes from the English version:
    5131             :  *
    5132             :  * - don't replicate in here the logic of ast_say_number_full_he
    5133             :  *
    5134             :  * - year is always 4-digit (because it's simpler)
    5135             :  *
    5136             :  * - added c, x, and X. Mainly for my tests
    5137             :  *
    5138             :  * - The standard "long" format used in Hebrew is AdBY, rather than ABdY
    5139             :  *
    5140             :  * \todo
    5141             :  * - A "ha" is missing in the standard date format, before the 'd'.
    5142             :  * - The numbers of 3000--19000 are not handled well
    5143             :  */

    5147             : #define IL_TIME_STR "HM"              /* NOTE: In Hebrew we do not support 12 hours, only 24. No AM or PM exists in the Hebrew language */

    5536           0 :                                 if (tm.tm_year > 99) {
    5537           0 :                                         res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/2", lang);
    5538           0 :                                         if (!res) {
    5539           0 :                                                 res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/thousand", lang);
    5540             :                                         }
    5541           0 :                                         if (tm.tm_year > 100) {
    5542           0 :                                                 if (!res) {
    5543           0 :                                                         res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year - 100, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
    5544             :                                                 }
    5545             :                                         }
    5546             :                                 } else {
    5547           0 :                                         if (tm.tm_year < 1) {
    5548             :                                                 /* I'm not going to handle 1900 and prior */
    5549             :                                                 /* We'll just be silent on the year, instead of bombing out. */
    5550             :                                         } else {
    5551           0 :                                                 res = wait_file(chan, ints, "digits/thousand", lang);

    5555           0 :                                                         res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year, ints, lang, (char * ) NULL);
    5556             :                                                 }
    5557             :                                         }
    5558             :                                 }

    5560           0 :                         case 'I':

    5564           0 :                                         ast_copy_string(nextmsg, "digits/12", sizeof(nextmsg));
    5565           0 :                                 else if (tm.tm_hour > 12)
    5566           0 :                                         snprintf(nextmsg, sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_hour - 12);
    5567             :                                 else

    5572           0 :                                 break;

    5574             :                         case 'k':

    5583           0 :                                         break;

    7881           0 :                 res = wait_file(chan, ints, fn, lang);

    7899             : 
    7900             : 
    7901             : 
    7902             : /*! \brief Greek support
    7903             :  *      A list of the files that you need to create
    7904             :  ->  digits/xilia = "xilia"
    7905             :  ->  digits/myrio = "ekatomyrio"
    7906             :  ->  digits/thousands = "xiliades"
    7907             :  ->  digits/millions = "ektatomyria"
    7908             :  ->  digits/[1..12]   :: A pronunciation of th digits form 1 to 12 e.g. "tria"
    7909             :  ->  digits/[10..100]  :: A pronunciation of the tens from 10 to 90
    7910             :                                  e.g. 80 = "ogdonta"
    7911             :                                  Here we must note that we use digits/tens/100 to utter "ekato"
    7912             :                                  and digits/hundred-100 to utter "ekaton"
    7913             :  ->  digits/hundred-[100...1000] :: A pronunciation of  hundreds from 100 to 1000 e.g 400 =
    7914             :                                  "terakosia". Here again we use hundreds/1000 for "xilia"
    7915             :                                  and digits/thousnds for "xiliades"
    7916             : */

    7937             :                         /* 13 < num <= 100  */

    7945             :                         /* 200 < num < 1000 */

    8051             : /*! \brief Greek support
    8052             :  *
    8053             :  * The format is  weekday - day - month -year
    8054             :  *
    8055             :  * A list of the files that you need to create
    8056             :  * digits/day-[1..7]  : "Deytera .. Paraskeyh"
    8057             :  * digits/months/1..12 : "Ianouariou .. Dekembriou"
    8058             :         Attention the months are in "gekinh klhsh"
    8059             :  */

    8074           0 :                 if (!res)
    8075           0 :                         res = ast_waitstream(chan, ints);

    8090           0 :                 res = ast_say_number(chan, tm.tm_year + 1900, ints, lang, (char *) NULL);

    8094             : 
    8095             : /* Japanese syntax */

    8509             :      struct ast_tm tm;

    8511             :      char sndfile[256], nextmsg[256];

    8513           0 :      if (!format)
    8514           0 :            format = "YbdAPIMS";
    8515             : 
    8516           0 :      ast_localtime(&tv, &tm, timezone);
    8517             : 
    8518           0 :      for (offset=0 ; format[offset] != '\0' ; offset++) {
    8519           0 :              ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Parsing %c (offset %d) in %s\n", format[offset], offset, format);

    8521             :                      /* NOTE:  if you add more options here, please try to be consistent with strftime(3) */
    8522           0 :                      case '\'':
    8523             :                              /* Literal name of a sound file */
    8524           0 :                              for (sndoffset = 0 ; (format[++offset] != '\'') && (sndoffset < sizeof(sndfile) - 1) ; sndoffset++) {
    8525           0 :                                      sndfile[sndoffset] = format[offset];

    8531             :                      case 'a':
    8532             :                              /* Sunday - Saturday */
    8533           0 :                              snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/day-%d", tm.tm_wday);
    8534           0 :                              res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
    8535           0 :                              break;
    8536           0 :                      case 'B':
    8537             :                      case 'b':
    8538             :                      case 'h':
    8539             :                              /* January - December */
    8540           0 :                              snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/mon-%d", tm.tm_mon);
    8541           0 :                              res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
    8542           0 :                              break;
    8543           0 :                      case 'd':
    8544             :                      case 'e':
    8545             :                              /* First - Thirtyfirst */

    8547           0 :                                      snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/h-%d_2", tm.tm_mday);
    8548           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
    8549           0 :                              } else if (tm.tm_mday < 30) {
    8550             :                                      /* Between 21 and 29 - two sounds */
    8551           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/20",lang);
    8552           0 :                                      if (!res) {
    8553           0 :                                              snprintf(nextmsg,sizeof(nextmsg), "digits/%d", tm.tm_mday - 20);
    8554           0 :                                              res = wait_file(chan,ints,nextmsg,lang);
    8555             :                                      }
    8556           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/nichi",lang);
    8557           0 :                              } else if (tm.tm_mday == 30) {
    8558             :                                      /* 30 */
    8559           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/h-30_2",lang);
    8560             :                              } else {
    8561             :                                      /* 31 */
    8562           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/30",lang);
    8563           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/1",lang);
    8564           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/nichi",lang);
    8565             :                              }
    8566           0 :                              break;
    8567           0 :                      case 'Y':
    8568             :                              /* Year */
    8569           0 :                              if (tm.tm_year > 99) {
    8570           0 :                                      res = wait_file(chan,ints, "digits/2",lang);
    8571           0 :                                      if (!res) {

    8979           0 :                                 ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unknown character in datetime format %s: %c at pos %d\n", format, format[offset], offset);
    8980             :                 }
    8981             :                 /* Jump out on DTMF */
    8982           0 :                 if (res) {
    8983           0 :                         break;
    8984             :                 }
    8985             :         }
    8986           0 :         return res;
    8987             : }
    8988             : 
    8989             : /*! \brief Georgian support
    8990             : 
    8991             :         Convert a number into a semi-localized string. Only for Georgian.
    8992             :         res must be of at least 256 bytes, preallocated.
    8993             :         The output corresponds to Georgian spoken numbers, so
    8994             :         it may be either converted to real words by applying a direct conversion
    8995             :         table, or played just by substituting the entities with played files.
    8996             : 
    8997             :         Output may consist of the following tokens (separated by spaces):
    8998             :         0, minus.
    8999             :         1-9, 1_-9_. (erti, ori, sami, otxi, ... . erti, or, sam, otx, ...).
    9000             :         10-19.
    9001             :         20, 40, 60, 80, 20_, 40_, 60_, 80_. (oci, ormoci, ..., ocda, ormocda, ...).
    9002             :         100, 100_, 200, 200_, ..., 900, 900_. (asi, as, orasi, oras, ...).
    9003             :         1000, 1000_. (atasi, atas).
    9004             :         1000000, 1000000_. (milioni, milion).
    9005             :         1000000000, 1000000000_. (miliardi, miliard).
    9006             : 
    9007             :         To be able to play the sounds, each of the above tokens needs
    9008             :         a corresponding sound file. (e.g. 200_.gsm).
    9009             : */
    9010           0 : static char* ast_translate_number_ka(int num, char* res, int res_len)
    9011             : {
    9012             :         char buf[256];
    9013           0 :         int digit = 0;
    9014           0 :         int remaining = 0;
    9015             : 
    9016             : 
    9017           0 :         if (num < 0) {
    9018           0 :                 strncat(res, "minus ", res_len - strlen(res) - 1);
    9019           0 :                 if ( num > INT_MIN ) {
    9020           0 :                         num = -num;
    9021             :                 } else {
    9022           0 :                         num = 0;
    9023             :                 }
    9024             :         }
    9025             : 
    9026             : 
    9027             :         /* directly read the numbers */
    9028           0 :         if (num <= 20 || num == 40 || num == 60 || num == 80 || num == 100) {
    9029           0 :                 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%d", num);
    9030           0 :                 strncat(res, buf, res_len - strlen(res) - 1);
    9031           0 :                 return res;
    9032             :         }
    9033             : 
    9034             : 
    9035           0 :         if (num < 40) {  /* ocda... */
    9036           0 :                 strncat(res, "20_ ", res_len - strlen(res) - 1);
    9037           0 :                 return ast_translate_number_ka(num - 20, res, res_len);
    9038             :         }
    9039             : 
    9040           0 :         if (num < 60) {  /* ormocda... */
    9041           0 :                 strncat(res, "40_ ", res_len - strlen(res) - 1);
    9042           0 :                 return ast_translate_number_ka(num - 40, res, res_len);
    9043             :         }
    9044             : 
    9045           0 :         if (num < 80) {  /* samocda... */

    9047           0 :                 return ast_translate_number_ka(num - 60, res, res_len);
    9048             :         }
    9049             : 
    9050           0 :         if (num < 100) {  /* otxmocda... */

    9052           0 :                 return ast_translate_number_ka(num - 80, res, res_len);
    9053             :         }
    9054             : 
    9055             : 
    9056           0 :         if (num < 1000) {  /*  as, oras, samas, ..., cxraas. asi, orasi, ..., cxraasi. */

    9058           0 :                 digit = (num - remaining) / 100;

    9065           0 :                         snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%d_ ", digit*100);
    9066           0 :                         strncat(res, buf, res_len - strlen(res) - 1);

    9068             :                 }
    9069             :         }
    9070             : 
    9071             : 
    9072           0 :         if (num == 1000) {
    9073           0 :                 strncat(res, "1000", res_len - strlen(res) - 1);
    9074           0 :                 return res;
    9075             :         }
    9076             : 
    9077             : 
    9078           0 :         if (num < 1000000) {
    9079           0 :                 remaining = num % 1000;
    9080           0 :                 digit = (num - remaining) / 1000;

    9091             :                 }

    9217             : /*! \brief Georgian syntax. e.g. "oriatas xuti tslis 5 noemberi".
    9218             : 
    9219             : Georgian support for date/time requires the following files (*.gsm):
    9220             : 
    9221             :  - mon-1, mon-2, ... (ianvari, tebervali, ...)

    9224             :  - tsuti
    9225             :  - tslis
    9226             : */

    9364             : 
    9365             : /*! \brief
    9366             :  * In English, we use the plural for everything but one. For example:
    9367             :  *  - 1 degree
    9368             :  *  - 2 degrees
    9369             :  *  - 5 degrees
    9370             :  * The filename for the plural form is generated by appending "s". Note that
    9371             :  * purpose is to generate a unique filename, not to implement irregular
    9372             :  * declensions. Thus:
    9373             :  *  - 1 man
    9374             :  *  - 2 mans (the "mans" soundfile will of course say "men")
    9375             :  */
    9376           0 : static const char *counted_noun_ending_en(int num)
    9377             : {
    9378           0 :         if (num == 1 || num == -1) {
    9379           0 :                 return "";
    9380             :         } else {
    9381           0 :                 return "s";
    9382             :         }
    9383             : }
    9384             : 
    9385             : /*! \brief
    9386             :  * Counting of objects in slavic languages such as Russian and Ukrainian the
    9387             :  * rules are more complicated. There are two plural forms used in counting.
    9388             :  * They are the genative singular which we represent with the suffix "x1" and
    9389             :  * the genative plural which we represent with the suffix "x2". The base names
    9390             :  * of the soundfiles remain in English. For example:
    9391             :  *  - 1 degree (soudfile says "gradus")
    9392             :  *  - 2 degreex1 (soundfile says "gradusa")
    9393             :  *  - 5 degreex2 (soundfile says "gradusov")
    9394             :  */
    9395           0 : static const char *counted_noun_ending_slavic(int num)
    9396             : {
    9397           0 :         if (num < 0) {
    9398           0 :             num *= -1;
    9399             :         }
    9400           0 :         num %= 100;                     /* never pay attention to more than two digits */
    9401           0 :         if (num >= 20) {             /* for numbers 20 and above, pay attention to only last digit */
    9402           0 :             num %= 10;
    9403             :         }
    9404           0 :         if (num == 1) {                 /* singular */
    9405           0 :             return "";
    9406             :         }
    9407           0 :         if (num > 0 && num < 5) { /* 2--4 get genative singular */
    9408           0 :             return "x1";
    9409             :         } else {                        /* 5--19 get genative plural */
    9410           0 :             return "x2";
    9411             :         }
    9412             : }
    9413             : 
    9414           0 : int ast_say_counted_noun(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char noun[])
    9415             : {
    9416             :         char *temp;
    9417             :         int temp_len;
    9418             :         const char *ending;
    9419           0 :         if (!strncasecmp(ast_channel_language(chan), "ru", 2)) {        /* Russian */
    9420           0 :                 ending = counted_noun_ending_slavic(num);
    9421           0 :         } else if (!strncasecmp(ast_channel_language(chan), "ua", 2)) { /* Ukrainian */
    9422           0 :                 ending = counted_noun_ending_slavic(num);
    9423           0 :         } else if (!strncasecmp(ast_channel_language(chan), "pl", 2)) { /* Polish */
    9424           0 :                 ending = counted_noun_ending_slavic(num);
    9425             :         } else {                                            /* English and default */
    9426           0 :                 ending = counted_noun_ending_en(num);
    9427             :         }
    9428           0 :         temp = ast_alloca((temp_len = (strlen(noun) + strlen(ending) + 1)));
    9429           0 :         snprintf(temp, temp_len, "%s%s", noun, ending);
    9430           0 :         return ast_play_and_wait(chan, temp);
    9431             : }
    9432             : 
    9433             : /*! \brief
    9434             :  * In slavic languages such as Russian and Ukrainian the rules for declining
    9435             :  * adjectives are simpler than those for nouns.  When counting we use only
    9436             :  * the singular (to which we give no suffix) and the genative plural (which
    9437             :  * we represent by adding an "x").  Oh, an in the singular gender matters
    9438             :  * so we append the supplied gender suffix ("m", "f", "n").
    9439             :  */
    9440           0 : static const char *counted_adjective_ending_ru(int num, const char gender[])
    9441             : {
    9442           0 :         if (num < 0) {
    9443           0 :             num *= -1;
    9444             :         }
    9445           0 :         num %= 100;             /* never pay attention to more than two digits */
    9446           0 :         if (num >= 20) {     /* at 20 and beyond only the last digit matters */
    9447           0 :             num %= 10;
    9448             :         }
    9449           0 :         if (num == 1) {
    9450           0 :             return gender ? gender : "";
    9451             :         } else {                /* all other numbers get the genative plural */
    9452           0 :             return "x";
    9453             :         }
    9454             : }
    9455             : 
    9456           0 : int ast_say_counted_adjective(struct ast_channel *chan, int num, const char adjective[], const char gender[])
    9457             : {
    9458             :         char *temp;
    9459             :         int temp_len;
    9460             :         const char *ending;
    9461           0 :         if (!strncasecmp(ast_channel_language(chan), "ru", 2)) {           /* Russian */
    9462           0 :                 ending = counted_adjective_ending_ru(num, gender);
    9463           0 :         } else if (!strncasecmp(ast_channel_language(chan), "ua", 2)) {    /* Ukrainian */
    9464           0 :                 ending = counted_adjective_ending_ru(num, gender);
    9465           0 :         } else if (!strncasecmp(ast_channel_language(chan), "pl", 2)) {    /* Polish */
    9466           0 :                 ending = counted_adjective_ending_ru(num, gender);
    9467             :         } else {                                               /* English and default */
    9468           0 :                 ending = "";
    9469             :         }
    9470           0 :         temp = ast_alloca((temp_len = (strlen(adjective) + strlen(ending) + 1)));
    9471           0 :         snprintf(temp, temp_len, "%s%s", adjective, ending);
    9472           0 :         return ast_play_and_wait(chan, temp);
    9473             : }
    9474             :
